01-03.title: Alaska Becomes 49th State
01-03.description: On January 3, 1959, Alaska was admitted as the 49th state of the United States.

01-04.title: Utah Becomes 45th State
01-04.description: On January 4, 1896, Utah was admitted as the 45th state of the United States.

01-05.title: National Hockey League Formed
01-05.description: On January 5, 1917, the National Hockey League (NHL) was formed in Montreal, Canada.

01-06.title: Feast of the Epiphany
01-06.description: Traditionally celebrated on January 6, this Christian feast day commemorates the visit of the Magi to the infant Jesus.

01-07.title: First U.S. Presidential Election
01-07.description: On January 7, 1789, the first U.S. presidential election was held, with George Washington unanimously elected.

01-08.title: Battle of New Orleans
01-08.description: On January 8, 1815, American forces defeated the British in the Battle of New Orleans, the final major battle of the War of 1812.

01-09.title: Apple Macintosh Unveiled
01-09.description: On January 9, 1984, Apple Computer unveiled the Macintosh, the first successful mouse-driven computer with a graphical user interface.

01-10.title: League of Nations Founded
01-10.description: On January 10, 1920, the League of Nations was formally established with the ratification of the Treaty of Versailles.

01-11.title: Amelia Earhart's Solo Flight
01-11.description: On January 11, 1935, Amelia Earhart became the first person to fly solo from Hawaii to California.

01-12.title: Haiti Earthquake
01-12.description: On January 12, 2010, a devastating 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck Haiti, killing approximately 230,000 people.

01-13.title: Treaty of Cahuenga Signed
01-13.description: On January 13, 1847, the Treaty of Cahuenga ended fighting in California during the Mexican-American War.

01-14.title: Treaty of Paris Ratified
01-14.description: On January 14, 1784, the Continental Congress ratified the Treaty of Paris, officially ending the American Revolutionary War.

01-15.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Born
01-15.description: Martin Luther King Jr. was born on January 15, 1929, in Atlanta, Georgia.

01-16.title: Prohibition Begins in U.S.
01-16.description: On January 16, 1920, the 18th Amendment went into effect, beginning Prohibition in the United States.

01-17.title: Operation Desert Storm Begins
01-17.description: On January 17, 1991, Operation Desert Storm began with airstrikes against Iraq following its invasion of Kuwait.

01-18.title: Captain Cook Reaches Hawaii
01-18.description: On January 18, 1778, Captain James Cook became the first European to reach the Hawaiian Islands.

01-19.title: Japan Leaves League of Nations
01-19.description: On January 19, 1933, Japan announced its withdrawal from the League of Nations following criticism of its occupation of Manchuria.

01-21.title: Concorde's First Commercial Flights
01-21.description: On January 21, 1976, the Concorde began its first commercial flights to London and Paris simultaneously.

01-22.title: Queen Victoria Dies
01-22.description: On January 22, 1901, Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom died after a reign of 63 years, 7 months.

01-23.title: 24th Amendment Ratified
01-23.description: On January 23, 1964, the 24th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified, abolishing poll taxes.

01-24.title: California Gold Discovery
01-24.description: On January 24, 1848, James W. Marshall discovered gold at Sutter's Mill in California, sparking the California Gold Rush.

01-25.title: First Winter Olympics
01-25.description: On January 25, 1924, the first Winter Olympics opened in Chamonix, France.

01-26.title: Australia Day
01-26.description: On January 26, 1788, the First Fleet arrived at Port Jackson, establishing the first European settlement in Australia.

01-27.title: Auschwitz Liberated
01-27.description: On January 27, 1945, Soviet troops liberated the Auschwitz concentration camp in Poland.

01-28.title: Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster
01-28.description: On January 28, 1986, the Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart 73 seconds into its flight, killing all seven crew members.

01-29.title: Kansas Becomes 34th State
01-29.description: On January 29, 1861, Kansas was admitted as the 34th state of the United States.

01-30.title: Mahatma Gandhi Assassinated
01-30.description: On January 30, 1948, Mahatma Gandhi was assassinated by Nathuram Godse in New Delhi, India.

01-31.title: U.S. Enters Space Age
01-31.description: On January 31, 1958, the United States launched its first satellite, Explorer 1, into space.

02-01.title: Columbia Space Shuttle Disaster
02-01.description: On February 1, 2003, the Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrated during re-entry, killing all seven crew members.

02-02.title: Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo
02-02.description: On February 2, 1848, the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo was signed, ending the Mexican-American War.

02-03.title: 16th Amendment Ratified
02-03.description: On February 3, 1913, the 16th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified, establishing federal income tax.

02-04.title: Facebook Launched
02-04.description: On February 4, 2004, Mark Zuckerberg launched Facebook from his Harvard dormitory room.

02-06.title: Queen Elizabeth II Ascends Throne
02-06.description: On February 6, 1952, Princess Elizabeth became Queen Elizabeth II following the death of her father, King George VI.

02-07.title: Great Fire of London
02-07.description: On February 7, 1812, a massive fire destroyed much of central London, though not as famous as the 1666 fire.

02-08.title: Mary, Queen of Scots Executed
02-08.description: On February 8, 1587, Mary, Queen of Scots was executed at Fotheringhay Castle in England.

02-10.title: Treaty of Paris Ends French and Indian War
02-10.description: On February 10, 1763, the Treaty of Paris was signed, ending the French and Indian War/Seven Years' War.

02-11.title: Nelson Mandela Released
02-11.description: On February 11, 1990, Nelson Mandela was released from prison after 27 years of incarceration in South Africa.

02-12.title: Abraham Lincoln's Birthday
02-12.description: Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States, was born on February 12, 1809, in Kentucky.

02-13.title: Firebombing of Dresden
02-13.description: On February 13-15, 1945, Allied forces firebombed Dresden, Germany, resulting in massive destruction and civilian casualties.

02-14.title: Saint Valentine's Day Massacre
02-14.description: On February 14, 1929, seven members of Chicago's North Side Gang were murdered by associates of Al Capone.

02-16.title: Lithuania Declares Independence
02-16.description: On February 16, 1918, Lithuania declared its independence from Russia and Germany.

02-17.title: First Issue of Newsweek Published
02-17.description: On February 17, 1933, the first issue of Newsweek magazine was published.

02-18.title: Pluto Discovered
02-18.description: On February 18, 1930, Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto at Lowell Observatory in Flagstaff, Arizona.

02-19.title: Japanese American Internment Begins
02-19.description: On February 19, 1942, President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed Executive Order 9066, authorizing Japanese American internment.

02-20.title: John Glenn Orbits Earth
02-20.description: On February 20, 1962, John Glenn became the first American to orbit the Earth aboard Friendship 7.

02-21.title: Malcolm X Assassinated
02-21.description: On February 21, 1965, Malcolm X was assassinated while speaking at the Audubon Ballroom in New York City.

02-22.title: George Washington's Birthday
02-22.description: George Washington, the first President of the United States, was born on February 22, 1732, in Virginia.

02-23.title: Iwo Jima Flag Raising
02-23.description: On February 23, 1945, U.S. Marines raised the American flag on Mount Suribachi during the Battle of Iwo Jima.

02-24.title: Gulf War Ground Offensive Begins
02-24.description: On February 24, 1991, the ground offensive of Operation Desert Storm began in the Gulf War.

02-25.title: People Power Revolution in Philippines
02-25.description: On February 25, 1986, the People Power Revolution ousted Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos from power.

02-26.title: World Trade Center Bombing
02-26.description: On February 26, 1993, a truck bomb exploded in the underground garage of the World Trade Center in New York City.

02-27.title: Reichstag Fire
02-27.description: On February 27, 1933, the German parliament building (Reichstag) was set on fire, a key event in Nazi Germany's rise.

02-28.title: Television's First Commercial
02-28.description: On February 28, 1939, the first television commercial aired in the United States during a baseball game.

03-01.title: Yellowstone National Park Established
03-01.description: On March 1, 1872, Yellowstone became the world's first national park when President Ulysses S. Grant signed the act into law.

03-02.title: Texas Declares Independence
03-02.description: On March 2, 1836, Texas declared its independence from Mexico, forming the Republic of Texas.

03-03.title: Treaty of Brest-Litovsk Signed
03-03.description: On March 3, 1918, Russia signed the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk with the Central Powers, exiting World War I.

03-04.title: First Inauguration in Washington D.C.
03-04.description: On March 4, 1801, Thomas Jefferson became the first president to be inaugurated in Washington, D.C.

03-05.title: Boston Massacre
03-05.description: On March 5, 1770, British soldiers killed five colonists in what became known as the Boston Massacre.

03-06.title: Dred Scott Decision
03-06.description: On March 6, 1857, the U.S. Supreme Court ruled in Dred Scott v. Sandford that African Americans could not be citizens.

03-07.title: Bloody Sunday
03-07.description: On March 7, 1965, civil rights marchers were attacked by state troopers on the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma, Alabama.

03-08.title: International Women's Day
03-08.description: First celebrated on March 8, 1911, International Women's Day honors women's achievements and promotes gender equality.

03-09.title: USS Monitor vs. CSS Virginia
03-09.description: On March 9, 1862, the first battle between ironclad warships, the Monitor and the Virginia, took place during the Civil War.

03-10.title: First Successful Telephone Call
03-10.description: On March 10, 1876, Alexander Graham Bell made the first successful telephone call, saying 'Mr. Watson, come here, I want to see you.'

03-11.title: Great Blizzard of 1888
03-11.description: On March 11-14, 1888, one of the most severe blizzards in American history struck the Northeast, causing massive disruption.

03-12.title: FDR's First Fireside Chat
03-12.description: On March 12, 1933, President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivered his first 'fireside chat' radio address to the American people.

03-13.title: William Herschel Discovers Uranus
03-13.description: On March 13, 1781, astronomer William Herschel discovered the planet Uranus, the first planet discovered with a telescope.

03-15.title: Ides of March - Julius Caesar Assassinated
03-15.description: On March 15, 44 BC, Roman dictator Julius Caesar was assassinated by a group of senators led by Brutus and Cassius.

03-16.title: My Lai Massacre
03-16.description: On March 16, 1968, American soldiers killed between 347 and 504 unarmed Vietnamese civilians in the My Lai Massacre.

03-17.title: Evacuation Day in Boston
03-17.description: On March 17, 1776, British forces evacuated Boston during the American Revolutionary War, celebrated as Evacuation Day.

03-18.title: Tripartite Convention Signed
03-18.description: On March 18, 1889, the Tripartite Convention established the colonial division of the Samoan Islands between Germany and the U.S.

03-19.title: Iraq War Begins
03-19.description: On March 19, 2003, the United States and coalition forces invaded Iraq, beginning the Iraq War.

03-20.title: U.S. Invades Iraq (2003)
03-20.description: On March 20, 2003, the United States launched its invasion of Iraq with 'shock and awe' bombing campaign.

03-21.title: Sharpeville Massacre
03-21.description: On March 21, 1960, South African police opened fire on a crowd of black protesters in Sharpeville, killing 69 people.

03-22.title: Stamp Act Passed
03-22.description: On March 22, 1765, the British Parliament passed the Stamp Act, imposing a direct tax on the American colonies.

03-23.title: Patrick Henry's 'Give Me Liberty' Speech
03-23.description: On March 23, 1775, Patrick Henry delivered his famous 'Give me liberty or give me death!' speech in Virginia.

03-24.title: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill
03-24.description: On March 24, 1989, the oil tanker Exxon Valdez ran aground in Alaska's Prince William Sound, causing a massive environmental disaster.

03-25.title: Triangular Slave Trade Abolished
03-25.description: On March 25, 1807, the British Parliament passed the Slave Trade Act, abolishing the slave trade in the British Empire.

03-26.title: Bangladesh Independence Day
03-26.description: On March 26, 1971, Bangladesh declared its independence from Pakistan, beginning the Bangladesh Liberation War.

03-27.title: Alaska Earthquake
03-27.description: On March 27, 1964, the Good Friday earthquake struck Alaska, the most powerful earthquake recorded in North American history.

03-28.title: Three Mile Island Accident
03-28.description: On March 28, 1979, a partial nuclear meltdown occurred at the Three Mile Island Nuclear Generating Station in Pennsylvania.

03-29.title: Vietnam War Ends for U.S.
03-29.description: On March 29, 1973, the last U.S. combat troops left South Vietnam, ending direct American military involvement in the Vietnam War.

03-30.title: President Reagan Shot
03-30.description: On March 30, 1981, President Ronald Reagan was shot and wounded by John Hinckley Jr. outside a Washington, D.C. hotel.

03-31.title: Eiffel Tower Opens
03-31.description: On March 31, 1889, the Eiffel Tower was officially opened to the public during the Exposition Universelle in Paris.
